required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-grafted Maxillary Sinus Floor Elevation With Simultaneous Implant Placement Using Different Implant Lengths
clinical_study.official_title: Non-grafted Maxillary Sinus Floor Elevation With Simultaneous Implant Placement Using Different Implant Lengths

brief_summary.textblock:
twenty recruited patients indicated for sinus augmentation and simultaneous implant placement will be divided into two groups (10 in each of the groups).to evaluate & compare bone formation & implant stability after shneiderian membrane elevation and augmentation with graft less tenting technique with different implant lengths.
group one will receive 8mm implant lenght while group two will receive 10mm implants.

primary_outcome.description: two cone beam CT will be done for the patients, one immediate post operative & the other 6 months post operative then the amount of gained bone will be assessed by superimposing the same section in the two cone beam CT.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: will be measured intra operative after implant insertion and will be measured once more 6 months post operative after the first operation at the time of implant exposure
secondary_outcome.description: measurement of the implant stability using OSSTELL device.

intervention.description: non grafted maxillary sinus floor augmentation with simultaneous implant placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient with atrophic maxilla & pneumatized maxillary sinus with residual bone height at least 4mm of residual ridge
- both sexes
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with systematic diseases that may affect normal healing
- sinus pathology
- heavy smokers more than 20 cigarettes per day
